Message.Title: psychology of trapped levered shorts....
Message.Msg: Shorts that started the week at 50% equity and did nothing (not like likely, more probable that they 'added') are sitting at 45% equity and feeling a weee bit trapped. Shorts that were 45% equity short starting the week that didnt do anything - subtract or add - are gonna start next week at 41% equity, possibly in a house call due on wed and sitting on the couch with this nail biter , wondering "should i push 'all in' using house money on Monday - perhaps go for the gusto" Shorts that started the beginning of the week at 40% equity are now sitting at 36% equity - DEEP into a house call and shieotting their pants.... Oooor They can cash in their chips in disgust and walk away down 22k for every 100k invested. Aaaaand shorts that started out their week at 35%-30% equity - prrrrraaaayyyyying for a reversal and getting plugged instead saw nirvana in an SEC call yesterday where they must have made good by the close, or be liquidated by their broker on monday to not only come into compliance with the SEC, but also the house requirements.... This iz a most GLORIOUS experience where the leveraged find religion in a short squuuueeeeze.... At 35% week start with the 9% move, here'z where theze poor slobz landed if they stood like deer in the headlights are at a WHOPPING .32% equity and FULLY in house callz due anywhere from last wed to this monday, staring at the prospect of DAMAGED share counts to meet margin maintenance.... If they were to Pick up their chips here then for every 100k levered short at 35% equity at the beginning of the week then they would be DOWN a WHOPPING 25k for every hundred K invested..... WOW! 32% equity levered shorts sitting over the weekend arent getting much sleep .... They are probably pretty irritable, and lord forbid the cat come out because it will be swiftly kicked. shorts starting last week 32% or lower and did nothing are DEAD. They have been called and forced out to house req throwing in the towel at -30k for every 100k.

Any shorts stepping in here will be violently fvck ed in the keister, this iz a hot stock, a new technological juggernaught, a new paradigm. This company iz truely different and there's so much depth to it....cnbc lovez it , analysts have looooots of positive thingz to say, MS even fronted a fully underwritten 3 BILLION dollar bond 5 months ago at HIGH RATED debt quality - no chance of bankruptcy.... Shieot! I missed the run up from 245-307 by being stupidly under invested and i dont want to miss out now with earningz just around the corner.... I'm going to buy any pull back available and really make some money going into earningz with on line christmas salez just down the road, and AWS ramping up revenuez - this iz a fantastic bet!!! Giddy up.... Buy buy buy!!!!

Topic.Title: Up 23 this week; how much more next week?

Message.Msg: This week was a massive short squeeze, when the technicals rail and the stock overshoots on no real news (just the Ben Pump) you can see it in the volume acceleration. Looks like 3M shorts or so covered Thurs/Fri. That be about half of total shorts. With risky earnings just 9 trading days away and the weekend a welcome breather for sanity to return, I would expect some longs to begin to take profits this upcomming week.

Topic.Title: New ground

Message.Msg: Thank God that earings on the 25th - just 9 trading sessions away. Reality will smack this puppy back down to size like last quarter. You just get the feeling that if Amazon never had to report this stock would be $1,000 as people don't want to know the facts, just buy baby buy! I am looking forward to seeing the current ratio this Q, as AMZN will start to exhibit some liquidity problems. Maybe employees will forego their salaries to be paid fully in stock to help Amazon's terrible cash flow situation.

Message.Title: Psychology of a robot
Message.Msg: OPERATION PIN PRICE this sub routine pinz the price without executing a trade while shorts sweat and pile out and eager longz add and pile in without actually ever making a stock trade 10: bid = last executed - .01 20: If last executed last executed + .001 then goto 10 Else go to 30: 30: If bid = last executed - .001 then goto 10 40: END subroutine of robot 2: inverse coding of robot 1 These two bot loops above pin the price and let retailerz do the yomanz work of moving the stock with price execution without buying or selling themselvez OPERATION DISTRIBUTE MOTHER LOAD Subroutine 3 : distribution bot.... This bot has madeits money and sit nueturally distributing without emothion on nothing more than volitity brought by humanz 05: LAST TRADE = 10: SELL1 = [LAST TRADE + .1] 20: SELL2 = [LAST TRADE - .1] 30: IF SELL1 OR SELL2 THEN ASK = BID @100 sharez ELSE GO TO 40 40: GOTO 10

Message.Title: Psychology of crack head put buyerz of all flavorz : weekly, monthly, leaps

Now may be ok to buy crack optionz for a GLORIOUS high, but chancez are that crackheadz that would buy puts have all done so and been murdered time and time again, and probably not think it a good idea. Straight shorts are down and may consider selling out of margin and buying expensive LEAPS from substantially reduced 100% maintenance requirement levelz - this could finish them off az they would tolerate no lossez and have been so mentally damaged that the 1 sign of a spike in price they would hair trigger dump their crack at another 15-30% hit on their gun powder. Nope - not much to report on the psychology of optionz traderz, because dead crackheadz dont think about too much.

Message.Title: Blow off tops and panic bottomz are an awesome sight to behold
Message.Msg: Many on this board, including sybil have seen 2 of each in the millenium, with a 3 rd blow off top in the making , and the MOTHER of all panic bottomz to come... How lucky we are to live in theze timez! Many have gone through dull yearz - an entire generation without much todo or action , just old fuddy duddy "buy hold and add the dips" markets: 1937-1965 and 1981 to 1998 were dull and boring with a once in a while out of the blue market smash like the 1987 CRASH - That waz exciting! ..... But since 1998 we've gotten to experience so much high speed bot driven excitement with MUUUCHO more fun to come in the next crash wave....

Message.Title: I am inventing the AMZN Rule
Message.Msg: The AMZN Rule: The stock goes up the same % of the forward earnings reduction by analysts after a Q release. Price is up 12.4% since earnings on an 11.2% drop in analyst estimated CY14 earnings Day of Q1 Earnings: Price: $274 CY14 EPS estimate: $3.58 FWD P/E: 77 Pre Q2 earnings: Price: $308 CY14 EPS Estimate: $3.18 FWD P/E: 97 If P/E remained at astronomical 77, Price would be $244.86 (which was the low it hit post earnings). Why does AMZN deserve such massive multiple expansion since April? Groceries????? Paying billions for old video content? Apple losing e-Book trial??

Topic.Title: I am inventing the AMZN Rule

Message.Msg: "CY14 EPS Estimate: $3.18" Interesting: as their peak 4 qtr earnings record EVER is $2.52: So in 2014, it will be interesting to see if the company can actually top the record ever made. We already know, that the analysts originally forecasted AMZN to be growing earnings to $5 by now originally from that $2.52. number. Instead, the earnings went down, stock more than doubled, and the analysts continue to rasie AMZN price tartgets relentlessly while lowering near earnings. Every investment AMZN has made has been rewarded big time by the market. They certainly have gotten a pass by the market to bottom line numbers for a long long time. In fact , forever. In fact, where shorts were right into the last few years is that there was a down cycle in earnings not forecasted by the WS analysts. What wasn't expected was not only wouldn't it matter, but also blow the stock out parabolically which it's now in the priocess of doing. AMZN stock didn't just jump the "shark" the last two years in the face of declining earnings, it skyrocketed to the moon here. I would have to agree with some who mention it here, that a lot of that, if all, has to do with the Federal Reserve's monthly QE purchases that ,expecially, seem to keep AMZN stock driving higher and higher. As long as the Bernanke put is there, Bezos may come closer and closer to attaining the wealth of Bill Gates and Carlos Slim, without even getting to the stage of showing consistent corporate profits to the balance sheet. Profits don't seem to matter, just QE backing right now and for so long now.

Message.Msg: +1, it's all about timing. You'll have to let the bulls have their runs especially is only being held up by momentum and fantasies. It can go to whatever, I don't care. All I know is I will be there in the end to ride it down. There will be obvious signs when the time comes. Low % short and high daily short volume means bears are trying to time this and so far the vast majority have been sheared. Don't fight the FED. Let the FED destroy itself, either soon or down the road. They are loosing control with the interest rates as the rest has figured out that there's no way that the government can pay down these debts without killing the economy and standard of living. This is the worst of both world, more worthless balance sheet stuffing while the debt payment balloon bigger. Very soon the FED balance sheet will take a big haircut if they're keep continuing with reckless abandoning. They should have stopped several years ago and let the market readjust but no. The rest of the world will not just stand by and let their dollars be destroyed because, it's their money too. They will force the FED to stop or slow down with the interest rates rise. It will be a slow death for the FED when their balance sheet is full of worthless treasury and toxic loans. Yes, they can buy unlimited amount of paper but who's going to bail the FED when these paper blow up??? How about converting bad paper to toilet paper? Everybody can use it after a good dump I suppose.

Message.Title: Time to sell, not necessarily short AMZN...
Message.Msg: IT may have another 10 percent to go on the upside but the downside is so steep you can't take that chance. (remember apple at 700?) and apple is a greatly profitable company. AMZN will never have enough profits even 20 years from now to justify today's valuation. Their biggest problem is WHEN this stock tumbles( and it will as they all do, remember netflix at 300 down to 60?), they will never recover because they underpay their employees and give them stock options, when the stock drops the brain drain at amazon will be so huge it will destroy the company for years to come.

Topic.Title: Amzn $400 to $800 stock

Message.Msg: Analysts thought that AMZN now first uses the low model model to get customers, someday it could flop the switch the switch to start making big money. That assumption is wrong and completely wrong. The key reason is that consumers, at least the majority are only have loyalty to the price. That's why a couple of year back NFLX lost customers after it increased subscription price, and its stock collapse to less than $60 at certain point. due to this reason. Having AMZN shares in your account just like having a time bomb. Someday, if it doesn't have growth, its stock could collapse more than 60-70% like what NFLX experienced.
